name: Moevenpick Resort Petra

reviews.text: If you are visiting Petra , there is no better location. This Movenpick is bang opposite the entrance of ancient city of Petra. The place is little smaller but given the location, it was okay. The food was good. Staff friendly. The roof top restaurant and bar was amazing in the evening with excellent view and good weather. The room was large enough with all modern amenties, seprate bath tub and shower cubicle. The breakfast was good but extra ordinary. Overall a good experience.
reviews.title: Great Location , the best in Petra

reviews.text: This is an outstanding hotel located within 100m of the entrance to Petra. The hotel is modern, spacious, spotless, and the food and service was outstanding. The rooms are large and immaculate, equipped with a complementary mini bar and WiFi.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel perfectly situated

reviews.text: great location and so close to the petra monument - adjacent. if you can get the suite ur in for a treat. the sunset and sunrise is magnificient. the suite has a large balcony. The restaurant serves some amazing arab and lebanese food.
reviews.title: great location and if you can get the suite ur in for a treat

reviews.text: This is a different type of Movenpick, smaller, more quaint, and friendlier. Other Movenpicks have friendly staffs, but this felt more like a small family-run hotel.
reviews.title: A Different Movenpick, But Enjoyable

reviews.text: The location couldn't be better, right at the entrance to the ancient city. We were out the door and on our way in a minute or so.
reviews.title: Your best choice in Petra!
Perfect Petra location
reviews.text: The location of this hotel couldn't be closer to the entrance of Petra - which was a huge relief after a full day of trekking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was quite nice, comfortable and decent size rooms. We ate at the mediterranean and rooftop restaurants and enjoyed both. There was some noise from the downstairs area and also the morning call to prayer.
reviews.title: The ideal starting point for Petra visit

reviews.text: The plus of this hotel is surely to be the nearest one to Petra entrance. After a long and tiring walk through the fantastic city, to be so near to your room and to the hotel facilities is really a pleasure. The hotel is comfortable and clean. Rooms are spacious, we have been pleasantly upgraded to a suite, well equipped with cooking, espresso machine and tea boiler. Good quality and variety of buffet at dinner as well as at breakfast time. Hotel is always crowded by every sort of tourists, not always properly behaving, in dress and attitudes. You can easily perceived that the hotel is used only as a basis for Petra visit, for one or two nights maximum stay: this affects the behavior of staff, especially waiters, a little rude, scarcely ready to fulfill customers needs, conscious that in any case new guests will come the day after. As a recommendation , a dress code should be asked for: it is not acceptable for a 5 stars hotel to admit guests at dinner time with bathroom slippers!
reviews.title: Petra with Swiss attention to detail

reviews.text: If you want 5-star accommodations and service, Movenpick Petra will not disappoint. The huge staff is just waiting to serve you. If we asked for it, they provided it, including a third bed in our room. The hotel offers a range of eating options: white napkin dinner spot; splendiferous buffet; snacks in the courtyard; an ice cream parlor; a bar; barbecue on the rooftop. There's an in-house ATM, quality gift shop, and upscale craft gallery. At Movenpick, the only thing you need to do is enjoy yourself (and pay the rather large bill).
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Excellent location at gates to Petra but otherwise fairly average hotel. Wouldn't say it is 5 star, maybe 4. Bathroom in room dated. Good breakfast. Good service and of course great Movenpick ice cream
reviews.title: Family holiday in Jordan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could not be better with the Petra park entrance less than 100m walk, and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for the staff here, so it becomes an obvious choice if you are wanting to visit Petra (and who wouldn't if in this part of the world)
reviews.title: A Chain Hotel with a Heart
Great location, but otherwise could do much better
reviews.text: The front desk/receptionists let their individuality shine through their corporate training , with a real sense of humour and fun.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior of the building is wonderfully styled around a central atrium with many locally derived features and decorations, giving it a very comfortable feel.
reviews.title: Best location for Petra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the breakfast buffet was excellent , great choice and quality. The rooftop barbeque was also good. The pool was nice to relax in at the end of the day but it was perhaps a little shady in the evenings.
reviews.title: Luxury after a phenomenal day in the desert

reviews.text: This hotel has the prime position outside the gates of Petra. It has a reasonable quality of accommodation. Rooms are a fair size but bathroom not great - more motel than hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely worth the price
Excellent location and service
reviews.text: What a great hotel! My partner and I stayed here for two nights whilst we explored Petra. We had a great experience with this hotel.

To start with we were offered a cold welcome drink during check-in and then we were upgraded to a suite. During our stay the staff were fantastic! They all went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. One porter particularly cheered us up as everytime we saw him he would beam a smile and greet us. He seemed to really enjoy his job.
reviews.title: Second visit to the Movenpick Petra

reviews.text: The highlight of staying at this hotel was the amazing rooftop restaurant/bar. We had a delicious dinner here and the ambience was lovely. Again, great staff serving.
reviews.title: A beautiful place to stay

reviews.text: Other good aspects were free wifi, the breakfast and of course the location! Moevenpick is the closest hotel to Petra and was a quick 2 min stroll to the entrance. Great after a long day exploring when you want to be in your room quickly!
reviews.title: We were not 'PETR(A)ified'!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to this hotel with our first and last visit being five years ago. The quality of the hotel has not deteriorated during that time and we enjoyed our stay here very much.
reviews.title: Very good choice in Petra

aka: Moevenpick Resort Petra Hotel Petra / Wadi Musa
description: Welcome to the hidden city. The Mövenpick Resort Petra is the ideal starting point for exciting excursions to the ancient City of the Nabateans. It also offers an enchanting atmosphere for you to relax and unwind as never before.
